greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest "inconsummate number" in base n: smallest number such that in base n, no number is this multiple of the sum of its digits.
mathematica: Do[n = 1; While[k = n; While[ Apply[ Plus, IntegerDigits[k, b] ]*n != k && k < 100n, k += n ]; k != 100n, n++ ]; Print[n], {b, 2, 54} ]
results.author: _J. H. Conway_, Dec 30 2000
ext: Corrected and extended by _David Radcliffe_, Jan 08 2001
More terms from _David W. Wilson_, Jan 10 2001
